message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The x-ray shows a sigmoid volvulus with a "coffee-bean" sign. Endoscopic detorsion is the treatment of choice for sigmoid volvulus. Intravenous antibiotic therapy is not indicated unless there is evidence of perforation or infection. Colonoscopy may also be used for detorsion, but it is not the first-line treatment. Rectal tube insertion may be used for decompression, but it does not address the underlying issue of the sigmoid volvulus.
